description: The user clicked and held the left mouse button on a blank area of the Windows XP desktop, initiating a drag-and-select action.
The user is about to open the Windows Desktop Properties window by right-clicking on the desktop and selecting the "Properties" option from the context menu.
The user opened the Display Properties window, navigated to the "Screen Saver" tab, and accessed the "Screen saver" dropdown menu to change the currently active screensaver, which is "Windows XP".
The user opened the "Display Properties" window, selected the "Screen Saver" tab, and chose "None" from the "Screen saver" dropdown menu to disable the screensaver.

The user is about to change the "Turn off monitor" setting within the "Home/Office Desk" power scheme. They will select a new time interval from the dropdown menu currently displaying "After 20 mins."
The user set the system to hibernate after 5 hours of inactivity while using the "Home/Office Desk" power scheme.

The user configured the "Home/Office Desk" power scheme in the Windows 98 "Power Options Properties" dialog.  All power management options ("Turn off monitor," "Turn off hard disks," "System standby," and "System hibernates") were set to "Never."
The user adjusted settings within the "Screen Saver" tab of the "Display Properties" dialog box and applied the changes by clicking "OK".
